title: Step by step approach to set up Jenkins for Android

This is a step by step guide to set up the automated build process using Jenkins CI for your Android projects. The following steps assume that you have new hardware with just any flavor of Linux installed. It is also taken into account that you might have a remote machine.

inline_content.Text: This is a step by step guide to set up the automated build process using Jenkins CI for your Android projects. The following steps assume that you have new hardware with just any flavor of Linux installed. It is also taken into account that you might have a remote machine.

title: PART I: Initial setup on your machine

inline_content.Text: PART I: Initial setup on your machine

title: Download a version of the Android SDK on your machine:

inline_content.Text: Download a version of the Android SDK on your machine:

title:
> sudo apt-get install tar  
> tar -xvf android-sdk_r24.4.1-linux.tgz

content_resolved.code:
> sudo apt-get install tar  
> tar -xvf android-sdk_r24.4.1-linux.tgz

title: Now you need to install Java 8 on your Ubuntu machine, which is a requirement for Android builds on Nougat. Jenkins would require you to install JDK and JRE 7 using the steps below:

inline_content.Text: Now you need to install Java 8 on your Ubuntu machine, which is a requirement for Android builds on Nougat. Jenkins would require you to install JDK and JRE 7 using the steps below:

title:
> sudo apt-get install python-software-properties  
> sudo add-apt-repository ppa:webupd8team/java  
> sudo apt-get update  
> apt-get install openjdk-8-jdk

content_resolved.code:
> sudo apt-get install python-software-properties  
> sudo add-apt-repository ppa:webupd8team/java  
> sudo apt-get update  
> apt-get install openjdk-8-jdk

title: Now install Jenkins on your Ubuntu machine:

inline_content.Text: Now install Jenkins on your Ubuntu machine:

title:
> wget -q -O - https://pkg.jenkins.io/debian/jenkins-ci.org.key | sudo apt-key add -  
> sudo sh -c 'echo deb http://pkg.jenkins.io/debian-stable binary/ > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/jenkins.list'  
> sudo apt-get update  
> sudo apt-get install jenkins

content_resolved.code:
> wget -q -O - https://pkg.jenkins.io/debian/jenkins-ci.org.key | sudo apt-key add -  
> sudo sh -c 'echo deb http://pkg.jenkins.io/debian-stable binary/ > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/jenkins.list'  
> sudo apt-get update  
> sudo apt-get install jenkins

title: Download the latest supported Gradle version for your Android setup:

inline_content.Text: Download the latest supported Gradle version for your Android setup:

title: Set up Android on your Ubuntu machine. First move to the
tools
i
folder in the Android SDK folder downloaded in step 2:

inline_content.Text: Set up Android on your Ubuntu machine. First move to the
folder in the Android SDK folder downloaded in step 2:

title:
> cd android-sdk-linux/tools **// lists available SDK**  
> android update sdk --no-ui **// Updates SDK version**  
> android list sdk -a | grep "SDK Build-tools" **// lists available build tools**  
> android update sdk -a -u -t 4   **// updates build tools version to one listed as 4 by prev. cmd.**  
> update java

content_resolved.code:
> cd android-sdk-linux/tools **// lists available SDK**  
> android update sdk --no-ui **// Updates SDK version**  
> android list sdk -a | grep "SDK Build-tools" **// lists available build tools**  
> android update sdk -a -u -t 4   **// updates build tools version to one listed as 4 by prev. cmd.**  
> update java
